description:
Hemispheres pits 2 halves of the same brain against each other. Each half is trying to control the entire brain. To do this, each player has the same 8 cards as their opponent.  Each player is trying to out think their opponent to swing the personality meter all the way to their side of the brain and take total control.

Turns are played simultaneously by choosing the card to play each round and then revealing them together (along with each cards special Trait chosen that turn).  After applying the Traits, the final Power values are compared to affect the Node track (score).  Cards have a cool off period before returning to the hand.  Choosing the right Power value and right Trait becomes a mind game against your opponent.  This game is best played against the same opponent repeatedly to get into each others's brains.

This game was originally designed for the 2016 2-Player PnP Contest.

—description from the designer

Fantasy themed game for 2-5 players where the board changes every time you play. Play cards from your hand against defending dice rolls in order to take control of land and net victory points for your faction. Brave wild encounters to attain powerful enhancements or gain helpful advantages without risk. Through the 10 rounds collect the most victory points in order to become the leading force on the board at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

Create magical mischief with Unicorn Surprise! In this whimsical game, players are transformed into pixies on the hunt for colorful unicorn gems. The only problem – unicorns drop their Gems but once a year! Race against other cheeky pixie players to collect the most gems before the smiling sun sets. Unicorn Surprise combines board game suspense with a silly unicorn figure that pixie players can interact with. Will she drop a colored gem or a clear one signifying the end of the day? Find out when you play Unicorn Surprise!

—description from the publisher

Catch Me! is a simple card game for 2 to 6 players. Each player receives a stack of face down cards displaying patterns in different colours. In the middle of the table there's a wooden stick up for grabs. Every round, a player turns over one of their face down cards. If two players have cards of the same pattern in front of them, both players compete to "catch" the stick first. The loser of this duel receives the winner's active cards to add to their stack. Whoever gets rid of all their cards first wins the game!

Duel cards are included as a variant.

—user summary

Have you ever planted a forest? If not, it's time!

Here you can hear birds singing, Help me through the trees!

In this game, we invite you to plant the forest! Your profit will be to grow five trees. Each of them consists of four parts. You roll two dice, and in the factory you choose more elements. The person who is the first to grow five trees wins.

The box comes with a seed! They are tiny, but do not be fooled by appearances. Giant trees will grow out of them!

—description from the publisher (translated)

"Gartenbau is a 2-4 player game in which players place and lay tiles in a tableau to meet the growing requirements of drafted flower tiles. A dual track rondel combined with three layers of tile laying are at the core of this beautiful game.

Take on the role of a gardener, seeking to wield your green thumb to grow a well-balanced, mature garden before the growing season ends.

You will sow seeds and grow a variety of plants to fill out your garden. In addition, if you meet the complex growing condition of your Flowers, you'll earn Prestige Points for your horticultural achievements.

The player who earns the most prestige at the end of the game is crowned The Master Gardener.

Gartenbau is set in the late 19th century and all of the artwork used in this game is vintage from that era. This game is dedicated to all of the unknown artists who created wonderful works for various seed and flower catalogs during that period, leaving their mark on a beautiful era for garden art."

é…’é­…äºº is a game about making SAKE (Japanese Rice Wine.) 
The player becomes the owner of SAKE brewery and decides which process to focus on SAKE made by himself.
All the attention boards dealt to players are the same. Every round player should bidding for the sequence to get the materiel. For that reason, it is important what kind of criteria you will score on sake made by yourself.

Because the evaluation point of sake is not equal to the victory point, you can scoop up your feet if you are too busy drinking!
No knowledge of sake is necessary, bow hits competing with each other!

This release is part of a 3-item set released in 2.5 inch round metal tins by University games. This game includes 30 second mysteries of "Solve the Mystery", "Solve the Mystery Gram", and "Solve the Brainteaser". Each includes 64 cards.

Trivial Pursuit: Rick and Morty allows fans of the hit television series to test their knowledge from 600 questions relating to Frienemies, Technology & Science, Locations, Rick and the Family, History & Events and a Wubalubadubdub Wild Card category.

IAM is an UNO-style card game with a party game overlay.

Each player starts with 4-7 cards in hand based on the player count. On a turn, play a card from your hand that matches either the number or color of the top card on the discard pile, then ask a question of a fellow player within a number of seats to you equal to the number on the card. (If you play a 2, for example, you must ask either your neighbor or the player next to them, going either clockwise or counter-clockwise depending on the direction of play.)

The topic of your question must be related to the card you just played, with blue cards relating to daily life, green society and community, red love and friendship, and yellow private matters. If the chosen player cannot answer or chooses not to, they must draw two cards, then the next player plays. If they answer the question, then they get to play a card. The game includes special cards, so the player questioned might be able to bounce the question back to the original questioner, pass it on to the next player, or require more people to answer as well.

If you have no matching cards on your turn, you draw a card and your turn ends. Alternatively, you might play a special card that reverses turn order or changes the color of cards that can be played.

Whoever plays all of their cards first wins!

"Custer's Last Stand" is an old school board-wargame of two of the most famous battles of the 1876 Sioux Campaign.  You get the battles of Rosebud Creek and the Battle of Little Big Horn.  The game comes with a large double sided hard mounted game board, 2 sets of rules, 2 double sided player aids, two ten-sided dice, 3 counter sheets,and a playbook.

Now be Crook at the Rosebud or Custer at the Little Big Horn OR Crazy Horse and Sitting Bull.

SEQUENCE OF PLAY SUMMARY FOR EACH TURN

1. Determine how many activation marker draws each side will draw for the turn.  Then place all eligible markers in an opaque container.

2. Draw one activation marker from the container.  If not usable, set aside and draw another activation marker until one drawn is eligible.

3. For the side drawn, use the activation marker to activate the corresponding units associated with the activation marker drawn.

4. Active units may move.

5. Complete all movement for those active units moving.

6. All active units adjacent to opposing units may attack the adjacent opposing units.

7.  End turn if all eligible activations have been drawn.  If not, repeat step 2 thru 7.

Victory is determined by killing units and terrain objectives.

Playable by 2 players in under 2 hours - Low complexity.

This game is based in London in 1890, and the player is setting up a department store.  The store consists of a number of departments, which each need to be filled with stock.  Customers come to the store with a list of items that need to be bought.  If all items are sold by a single player's department store, then that player wins that customer.  If the customer still has items remaining to be bought, then they move onto the next player's department.

This is mainly a card-based game, where customers, items to be bought, and departments are represented by cards, and stock is represented by small wooden cubes.  On a player's turn, they can choose a customer from 3 available customers, who each have a number of items that they want to buy, the number of which are decided by the roll of a dice.  Only the number of items to buy is visible to the player, not the actual items themselves, so it's only when the customer is chosen that the items are revealed and the player knows what can be sold.  Players receive money for items sold, which can then be used to buy new stock or new departments at the end of their turn.

The game relies on players choosing the right departments to set up, depending on what other players have already chosen, and deciding which departments should get restocked and at what time, especially when money is limited.  A player wins by being the player with the highest number of customers that had all items sold during one turn.  There are bonus points available for having the majority of customers in each family of customer.

Game contains 70 cards, 50 wooden cubes, 1 dice, 45 £1/£2/£5/£10 notes and a rule book.

-description from designer

This is the third edition of very popular Warhammer Fantasy Battles wargame, with a complex movement system and new specialist troop types.

Warhammer Fantasy Battles is a tabletop game for two or more players where you command several armies from a huge range that goes from Humans, Dwarves, Elves, Undead, Orcs, Beastmen, Ratmen called Skaven, and other fantasy races. This starter set provides you with all the rules you need to play, a core for two armies, and guides you through collecting and painting your own army of Citadel miniatures.

The Warhammer rulebook is a 304-page hardback book. Within its covers the book is divided into seven sections: Introduction, The Basic Game, Advanced Rules, Magic, The Warhammer World, The Bestiary, and Forenrond's Last Stand.

Praise is a game about discovering who is giving you genuine versus fake compliments. In Japanese culture, many people praise others as a cultural norm, but your true friends have to be discovered by their honest praises!

This new version of the game has been translated and updated by Jordan Draper, with a bonus cool guy standee, giant custom die, and emotion cards that must be implemented when giving complements.

—description from the publisher

Extra pack of challenges to play over Christmas.
This game is all about completing secret missions. Each of the mission requires you to trick one of the other players. When you open the pack, it's really important that you read the rules and don't look at all the cards. Otherwise, you won't be able to play (and you just might ruin Christmas).

A game of convention goals, but mostly horseplay.

All of the fun (and sometimes frustration) of attending a convention in one convenient game!

Collect swag, signatures, art or attend panels and other events to accumulate the most "fun" or "points" and have the best convention ever!

As with most conventions, however, sometimes things don't go quite as planned as your time quickly slips away.

Play against your friends and inconvenience them from obtaining their goals while attempting to achieve your own!

—description from the publisher

Turn by turn in NU2, you choose tiles to build a path between your pawns: one path forward and one path back. Choose wisely, or you might be help another player to win the game.

—description from the publisher

Shadows of the Academy is a cooperative card game designed for students in grades 4-7. Created as part of Alberta Health's tobacco prevention curriculum, the game has players take the roles of students in a mysterious academy, trying to defeat dastardly villains while keeping their friends safe. The students all have two unique ability cards that may be played once during the game.

Players win when they defeat 5 villains, but they lose if any player is unable to draw at the beginning of their turn, or if the deck of cards is depleted before all 5 villains are defeated.

Players may play cards from their hand to heal themselves or their peers, or to weaken villains. Harm cards lower hand size, so keeping an eye on each other is an integral part of the gameplay, as cards drawn at the end of a round could be helpful, they could be harmful, or they could be another villain to fight!

-description from designer

This is the second edition of very popular Warhammer Fantasy Battles wargame, released shortly after the first edition.

Warhammer Fantasy Battles is a tabletop game for two or more players where you command several armies from a huge range that goes from Humans, Dwarves, Elves, Undead, Orcs, Lizardmen, and other fantasy races. This starter set provides you with all the rules you need to play, a core for two armies, and guides you through collecting and painting your own army of Citadel miniatures.

This edition consists of three books: Combat, Magic, and Battle Bestiary.

Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game. There are many editions, themed siblings, and promo cards available.

Explore the farthest reaches of the universe in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine Fluxx! Work alongside Benjamin Sisko, Quark, Jadzia Dax, Worf and all your other favorite space station personnel while you try to gather Gold-Pressed Latinum and study The Wormhole — but watch our for nasty Surprises and Creepers like the Founders and the Jem'Hadar.

—description from the publisher

In Star Trek Chrono-Trek, a time-travel game similar to Chrononauts but set in the Star Trek universe, each player becomes a Star Trek character with a unique identity and a secret mission. During the game, players travel backwards and forwards through history, doing all those things people have always dreamed of using time travel to do: Visiting the great moments of the past, peeking into the future, collecting up artifacts, coming to grips with the paradoxes of time travel, and of course, changing pivotal events and altering the course of history itself.

Explore the history (and alternate history!) of the entire Star Trek universe in this version of Chrononauts. Try to alter history to restore your specific timeline! Maybe you need to ensure that the Federation gets founded, or just retrieve the Orb of Time and some tea. Earl Grey. Hot.

—description from the publisher
The boxed set for the sixth edition of Warhammer contained the rulebook and two small forces, Orcs vs. Empire.

With the No Trumps card game, gameplay is simple yet interesting and always entertaining. The "reader" reads off two quotes from the selected card. The other players then have to guess which quote was actually said by Donald Trump. The player with the fewest Trump cards after ten rounds is declared the winner.

After a dark decade of pirating and pillage, the Solar Federation has managed to locate the base of the dreaded Vropt in the vicinity of Mars. With the loyalist forces decimated, the mission to cleanse the pirate menace has been entrusted to a small squadron of four aces: former living legends now turned bounty hunters.

Martian Slayers is a free Print-and-Play cardgame that reproduces a 16-bit shmup videogame from the 90s era! Each player takes control of a ship with 3 lives, 2 or 3 bombs, and some Maneuvers. You are supposed to kill as many enemies as possible while minimizing the incoming fire, because any hit will make our ship explode.

—description from the designer

What really ended the dinosaurs' reign? Was it a supernova? A giant meteor? Or just mean card play? You'll have a good idea after just one game of Extinction: The Last Game They Ever Played.

It's survival of the fittest in this fast-paced game where everything from thundering meat-eaters to natural disasters are out to make your dinosaur herds extinct.

During the Gene Pool, players unleash sneaky, egg-eating Oviraptors, a dreaded Turannosaurus Rex, and catastrophic events in attempts to make opponents' herds extinct.

Extinction comes with three decks of quality playing cards, a set of ten embossed herd extinction markers, a plastic storage tray and a millenium of fun.

—description from the publisher

Join Kiara, Kovu, Timon, and Pumbaa on a challenging trip across moving logs and hungry crocodiles. 
Spin a dial to move 1 to 4 logs ahead or to move one of the movable logs.  Travel across the logs until you reach the end, except the movable logs may move you forward, backward or prevent you from moving ahead.

11:59 on the Doomsday Clock. DEFCON 1. Launch codes ready. Silos loaded and ICBMs armed. Nuclear War is imminent. Your president, still clinging to a dwindling hope of diplomacy, deep underground with you and a lucky few,  shakes with anticipation. They all look to you. Kill or be killed. Survive. Roll the dice and hope you have what it takes to defend a nation, your country, your home.

11:59 is a 2-Player micro dice game that requires lightning-quick decisions, dexterity and stamina. As a decorated General on the verge of war your mission is to either succeed through diplomacy or destroy your enemy’s bunker and VIPs before your enemy beats you to it. Each General controls two dice and a missile silo full of nuclear warheads while hidden in a bunker. Launch nukes, employ propaganda and fortify your bunker to become victorious. Do you have what it takes to win?

MISSION: You must kill your enemy’s VIPs or collect 5 diplomacy gems.

SETUP: You start the game with 2 VIP meeples, 2 chevron bunkers (stacked) and 1 nuke in the unloaded position (laying on side). The diplomacy gems & extra chevron bunkers are set in the center of the table within reach.

HOW TO PLAY: You will roll 2 dice simultaneously and continuously (in real-time) with your enemy until you complete your mission.

Roll 7 – If you roll 7 you may either earn 1 diplomacy gem (add 1 gem to your side of the table) or rebuild your bunker (add 1 chevron to your bunker stack) at the cost of 1 diplomacy gem (send 1 gem back to the table).

Roll Doubles – If you roll Doubles you may load your nuke (place your nuke in the upright position), launch your nuke (lay your nuke on its side) to remove 1 enemy chevron bunker (send the chevron bunker to the table) or VIP (remove the VIP from play) if no chevron bunkers remain, or employ propaganda (send 1 of your enemy’s diplomacy gems to the table).

Continue rolling until you’ve killed your enemy’s VIPs or acquired 5 diplomacy gems.

-description from designer

A stand-alone solo/coop pen and paper adventure game based on Greek mythology.
—user summary

Four Against the Titans is a pen and paper adventure game designed for solitaire or RPG-lite co-operative games. Set in ancient Greece in a time of myths and legends, players choose heroes from ten different character types to complete mighty quests and battle creatures such as centaurs, harpies and maenads, all in an attempt to defeat the titans and forestall the destruction of Greece.

Based on the Four Against Darkness series of dungeon delving adventures, Four Against the Titans is a standalone game. You don't require any other rule sets to play this game.

—description from the publisher

How exciting to be on safari, trying to spot all your favourite animals... but, hang on, one of them has wandered off!
Be the first to spot the missing animal!

The double-sided cards feature two levels of play. Choose the side with 7 possible animals for children or for learning the game, and choose the other side with 12 possible animals for a challenge!

In every card there is one missing animal compared to the key cards showing all possible animals. There is no taking turns, you can take the card if you are the first player to identify that missing animal!

After one of the piles runs out, the game ends. The player that has collected most cards wins the game.

Fun and frantic card game of matching and observation.

Play as Robin Hood and his merry men in this solo card game. As Robin Hood you’ll rob from the rich, give to the poor battle the Sheriff of Nottingham, his goons and recruit your merry men. Increase your influence over the people to gain power and win the game, but be careful, the Sheriff has put a bounty on your head. If it gets too high the people will turn you in for the reward.

Robin Hood: Hero of the People is a solo card adventure. The object of the game is to recruit your band of Merry men consisting of Maid Marian, Little John, Will Scarlett, Friar Tuck, Alan a Dale and Much the Miller. There is also a bounty on your head. During the game the bounty will increase so be careful that it doesn't get too high.

Each turn has 3 phases, Rob the Rich, Action and story Phases. During the rob the rich phase draw 3 cards from the loot deck. These include resources that you will use to complete actions.

During the action phases, play resource cards to recruit characters, decrease the bounty, build your Sherwood Forest camp and buy special abilities from King Richard

During the story phase, draw and resolve a story card. Story cards add extra challenges to players, some you can overcome, some you can't.

Once you have other characters recruited you can swap to take advantage of special character abilities.

Once you have all the characters available and the bounty set at 500 gold or lower, you have won the game. If at anytime the bounty tracker reaches 1000 gold or you play the final story card, you lose.

-description from designer

The Mysterious Library had a collection of special books. They provided REAL adventures for the readers who became a character of the story. They could train dragons, search for treasures, sail on the Nile, all this for a library fee of a few cents.

One day an inventor came to make experiments with the books: Mr. Mean did awful destruction with his projector blade. In the damaged books the continuity of the story was broken and the adventurers had trapped by them and couldn’t return to reality.

Your mission is to collect all parts of the destroyed books to set the adventurers free. You also have to disarm those projector blades that Mr. Mean activates one by one in the library to save the building from collapsing by the devastating magical power. The mission can be successful only if you all return to your headquarters without any harm. Every member of your team has a special talent which can help you during the game and if you use these talents skillfully, and in coordination, with each other, your mission will be successful!
—description from the publisher

Fifteen centuries have passed since Jesus descended from his cross, bathed Jerusalem in blood, and conquered Rome. The world has been ruled by inquisitors ever since.

Flame and Cross are symbols of The Holy Office, the institution whose sole purpose is to spread and defend the one and only true faith. But these symbols also contradict each other, for one represents Persian mages of fire, the other righteous Christians who fight them. The struggle goes on.

In this petty world, fear paralyzes the hearts of those who shy away from ruthless eradication of any signs of evil or corruption. This world is not even full of secrets, but it is surrounded by them, wallows in them, and cannot get away from them. Whenever an answer to a question is found, ten more questions appear immediately.

Inquisitor is a detective board game based on the series of best-selling short stories by Jacek Piekara that take you to the grim, fictional world of inquisitors.

Important note: Not any content of the game, neither images, nor the plot or background, is intended to offend anyone's religious feelings as they are merely props of a popular category known as "Religious Fiction".

Mortem et Gloriam (MeG for short) is a wargame where you take charge of an army from the ancient world - loosely defined as the period before gunpowder and firearms. You command an army of 50 - 100 bases of painted figures, moving them on a table with model terrain that represents a battlefield.

You are the Army Commander and, with your key Sub-Generals, control your army in attempt to smash your opponent. So you could be Alexander with his leading subordinates Parmenio and Ptolemy, or Hannibal with Hasdrubal and Hanno, or Vercingetorix the Gaul with the leaders of the main Gallic tribes, or Ghengis and Kublai .... the choice is yours.

Put simply Mortem et Gloriam lets us become a general in the ancient world.

—description from publisher

Battle Penguins can be played with 2-6 players in a head-to-head battle to see who earns the most fish.

Each game consists of three rounds of three goals each, and in each round you are vying for the first, second, or third place prize in three of four characteristics: strength, agility, wisdom, cuteness. Each combatant penguin has stats in each of the four characteristics, and you draft your army, then form three groups to battle others at each location. Some penguins have special abilities depicted, e.g., giving presents to other players. The winners receive fish based on the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place prizes.

Whoever has the most fish after three rounds wins.

Mechanica Inc. will make the world spotless with their Tidybots: ambitious vacuum robots made for global DOMINATION cleanliness! Humans are messy. It’s time they got some help!

Build the best Tidybot factory and ship out as many Tidybots as possible to prepare for (the definitely harmless) OPERATION CLEANUP. The player who has sold the most money worth of Tidybots wins!

Mechanica is a game of tile-laying and engine building. Each player buys puzzle piece-shaped machines and slots them together to form their factory. The different machines all improve the Tidybots your factory can make: building new Tidybots, upgrading them, copying them, and more. There are many strategies for putting your machines together, and everyone has fun trying to build the perfect factory!

Players compete to buy the best machines for their factory at the best prices  while running their factories, shipping out Tidybots for profit, completing specialty bot blueprints to fill their vaults with money, and turning the rotating shop wheel.

Awards & Honors:

BostonFIG Fest // 2019 - Most Innovative

Vancouver Buses is a roll and move game in which players take on the roles of bus drivers travelling around Vancouver. The first player to complete a circuit beginning and ending at the Kootenay Loop exchange wins.

The game was developed by the Vancouver Environment Education Project at the University of British Columbia to familiarise six to ten year old children with the Vancouver transit system.

—user summary

Jazzy Pips is a quick, cooperative dice game played in real-time for 3 to 6 players.

You’ve just formed a jazz band! It won’t be easy though. You know your instrument well, but you need to get to know the other musicians you’re playing with. This is the fun of joining a band! With practice, coordination, and the right tempo, you’ll be pulling off a memorable set at the local club in no time!

In Jazzy Pips, each player, or Musician,  must work together to overcome Song Cards by using your dice and making quick decisions at the same time. If you complete the Finale, you win! Be careful though, as the clock is ticking, and your dice are limited!

—description from the designer

Reel Masters is a 1-8 player tabletop fishing game. Move your boat, choose your lure and cast your line in hopes of hooking the monsters! Once you hook a fish, roll your dice against the fish to determine who is stronger. Pull hard enough and you can land the fish and earn a chance at cash for powerful upgrades.

Reel Masters has 5 species of game fish commonly found in lakes throughout the United States. This unique game truly captures elements of the real life experience.

Compete in multiple game modes with teams, solo or co-op. If your boat has the most total weight at the end of the game you win! The board changes every time you play and with multiple ways to play, Reel Masters is sure to bring fun to the table.

Good Luck and Tight Lines!

—description from the publisher

Goblin Derby is a racing game for 2-4 players. The first player to finish 3 laps around the dangerous and haphazard track is the winner.

Before the race starts players must first scavenge parts from the junkyard to build their, often wacky, vehicle. Then, after assembling their monstrosity, players roll dice to move their cart along the track.

Watch out for the other players, they will try anything to win from ramming you to throwing rocks to shooting rocket propelled goblins.

—description from the publisher

Jumble Jam is a family card game for 2 to 5 players, where each player takes the role of a grandchild working for their grandma during a day at work!

The business has been running smoothly for decades, being passed down from parent to child. Will it remain the reference bakery of the city, or will the grandchildren’s chaos and unrest finish off the successful family business?

The game objective will be complete the largest amount of clients orders or complete the necessary clients orders to win a game. First of all, we'll need to get the desserts that have just come out from the kitchen by placing our tokens before our friends! All of you play with the same desserts so try to be the one who gets it first!

Our clients are hungry! So complete clients orders to win points, but take care of your grandma! (who is always watching you and doesn't want to waste food!).

The first who reach the necessary amount of complete orders or have the largest amount of complete orders win the game!

Sjónarspil is an Icelandic family and party game. Players get cards with adjectives and must choose the cards that best fit their opponents. Who in the group is the nerd and who is the helpful one? There is no correct answer, as players get more points the more players choose the same adjective. Great game for your group of friends, as the rules are simple, playing time is short and everyone acts at the same time - no wait for others.

—user summary

In Hispánica, The Conquest of the History of Spain, there are battles, conquests, betrayals, pacts, knowledge tests and many more emotions. Share your passion for history, have fun and learn with more than 220 characters and historical facts that, from prehistory to the Constitution of 1978, will be parading during the game.
Is a game of strategy and knowledge that brings together characters and historical facts and offers players the possibility of conquering Spain.

With 128 characters, 64 relevant events and more than a thousand historical references, Hispanica intends to give a turn of the screw to historical games to bring them closer to those interested in History and the gamers. It is a game designed to learn from scratch or reaffirm previous knowledge of History.

—description from the designer

In the hilarious Pour Taste game, players choose 6 ingredients (ingredients not included) and fill each cup with one of them. Then, each player takes a turn spinning the spinner. The spin will tell the player which ingredients to mix up -- or whether to choose another player to drink, steal chips, or go bankrupt. Will the drink taste ok or totally gross? It's up to the player to decide whether or not they will drink up. Every time a player drinks from a cup, they earn a chip. If they decide not to drink the concoction, they lose a chip. The first player to get 4 chips wins.

—description from the publisher

Welcome to Rolling Orchards, a 2-player game of growing apples and pumpkins at your personal orchard. Turn them to pies and cider to accumulate more points than your opponent. Make the most out of your resources as the season could be over before you know it.

Rolling Orchards utilizes a dice placement mechanic where players select dice from a pool and place them in turn on action spaces. The number and color of the die determine the benefit gained from that space.

Third Place finisher in the Roll and Write Global Jam 2018!

—description from the designer

Smash City is the action-packed game of Kaiju combat! Toss your giant monster dice at your foes to perform devastating attacks! Crush cities and spread fire, electricity, poisonous gas and radiation! Throw cars and destroy tanks! Inflict maximum carnage like a true Kaiju!

Players must have good aim and a deft hand as they roll their monster dice into the city, knocking down buildings and attacking anything within range. You might even be able to throw cars at your foes!

Each of the four Kaiju has special powers and each favors a particular energy type. Use these to crush your foes and smash the city!

Players gain SMASH! cards as they destroy the city and will have to use their cards and powers to full effect if they hope to overcome their foes and be the victor of Smash City!

—description from the publisher

The Awkward Storyteller is a straightforward party game for creative people. Players have to think in original twists an plot lines for their story, which they make up as they go along, for the entertainment of the other players and anyone else who is listening.
The game begins when a player (the Storyteller) selects a Story Card and reads out the caption upon it, which will be the first line of a story that has yet to be created. The other players then ask the Storyteller creative and difficult to answer questions and play a letter or word Question Card. The Storyteller must develop his or her story ad hoc. This must be done using the specific word on the Question Card in the answer, or beginning the answer with the letter featured on the Question Card, depending which type was played.
Players then have an opportunity to challenge an answer that they feel doesn't make sense, and all players would then vote to validate or discard an answer. If an answer gets discarded, the Storyteller's turn ends.

Whilst primarily designed as a party game for fun, answers can be awarded points if players wish to keep score. Once everyone has been the Storyteller, the player with the most points would win.

Unleash your inner artist with Fantastiq!

Each round you receive a commission, a title describing the thing you must sculpt. All players make their creations at the same time using the included modeling clay. When everyone is done, it's time for the exhibition! You have to associate the correct title to each sculpture, and you earn points for each correct guess. You also gain points depending on how much your own sculpture has been guessed by the other players!

Lion’s Heart, Saracen’s Steel: The Battle of Arsuf, September 7, 1191. This is the latest game in  the Battles of the Middle Ages Series, an easy to learn wargame system that tries to recreate most of the principal battles fought from Roman Times to the dawning of Renaissance. These games are designed to be fast and furious, easy to learn and to play, but still true to the historical events portrayed. Lion's Heart, Saracen's Steel portrays the decisive battle of Arsuf. Richard the Lionhearted led the Crusader Army that was confronted by the legendary Ayyubid leader, Saladin. Although the Crusaders emerged victorious in this hard fought battle, the Third Crusade was ultimately a failure. Can you do as well or better?
